title: CPRE 3810 Teaching Assistant
bullets: Overseeing 46 students in lab for computer architecture, assisting students with issues related to computer architecture.
Assisting professor with conversion from MIPS-based architecture to RISC-V.

title: Undergraduate Researcher
bullets: Collaborated directly under a graduate mentor implementing 5G networking outdoors to bring high-speed, reliable internet to rural areas.
Updated existing 5G software to work outdoors with amplifiers, utilizing C and C++ to drive SDR output pins, resulting in a 48 dB (1048x) signal improvement.
Tested and implemented Mender for remote software updates on towers to avoid manual scaling for updates.

title: Small Business Owner
bullets: Created a business model for mobile vehicle detailing focused on high quality and fast turnaround, achieving a 78% margin.
Designed and managed a marketing campaign using posters and social media, generating dozens of impressions and sales.

title: Undergraduate Research Programmer
bullets: Collaborated with a remote, diverse team of researchers to develop Android digital forensics tools for the EviHunter project.
Developed a web crawler to scrape several hundred Android APK files and metadata for the project database.
Recovered the original MongoDB database after a system wipe, restoring critical project data.

title: CAD Technician
bullets: Designed and drafted over 150 AV, network cabling, and security drawings for technicians using AutoCAD LT.
Collaborated with sales and design teams to ensure drawings met installation technician and client standards.

title: Skills
bullets: Tools: AutoCAD LT, Android Studio, Unity, QuestaSim, Sphinx, CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, ModelSim, LTSpice, TensorFlow
